fields.label: Environment
fields.description: The name of the environment used as a baseline

fields.label: Enable Upgrades
fields.description: Set true to enable automatic micro version product upgrades.

fields.label: Include minor version upgrades
fields.description: Set true to enable automatic minor product version upgrades.

fields.label: Use Image Tags
fields.description: Set true to enable image tags, disabled by default. This will leverage image tags instead of the image digests.

fields.label: Use Openshift CA
fields.description: Set true to use Openshift's CA bundle as a truststore, instead of java's cacert.

fields.label: Image registry
fields.description: URL of a custom registry where RHPAM images are stored

fields.label: Insecure
fields.description: Selected if image registry is insecure

fields.label: Username
fields.description: Administrative username for RHPAM components

fields.label: Password
fields.description: Administrative password to use instead of generating default value

fields.label: URL
fields.description: RH-SSO URL

fields.label: Realm
fields.description: RH-SSO Realm name

fields.label: SSO admin user
fields.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Username used to create the Client if it doesn't exist

fields.label: SSO admin password
fields.description: RH-SSO Realm Admin Password used to create the Client

fields.label: Disable SSL cert validation
fields.description: Disable SSL Certificate Validation

fields.label: Principal attribute
fields.description: RH-SSO Principal Attribute to use as username

fields.label: Roles properties file
fields.description: When present, the RoleMapping Login Module will be configured to use the provided file. This property defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or resource which maps roles to replacement roles. The format is original_role=role1,role2,role3

fields.label: Replace roles
fields.description: Whether to add to the current roles, or replace the current roles with the mapped ones. Replaces if set to true.

fields.label: Kind
fields.description: Reference Kind for the RoleMapper.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Reference object name for the RoleMapper.

fields.label: URL
fields.description: LDAP endpoint to connect for authentication. For failover set two or more LDAP endpoints separated by space.

fields.label: BindDN
fields.description: Bind DN used for authentication

fields.label: BindDN password
fields.description: LDAP Credentials used for authentication of bindDN

fields.label: LoginModule Flag
fields.description: A flag to set login module to optional. The default value is required

fields.label: JAAS security domain
fields.description: The JMX ObjectName of the JaasSecurityDomain used to decrypt the password.

fields.label: BaseCtxDN
fields.description: Base DN of the top-level context to begin the user search.

fields.label: Base filter
fields.description: Search filter used to locate the context of the user to authenticate. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. A common example for the search filter is (uid={0}).

fields.label: Search scope
fields.description: The search scope to use.

fields.label: Search time limit
fields.description: The timeout in milliseconds for ldap searches.

fields.label: DN attribute
fields.description: The name of the attribute in the user entry that contains the DN of the user. This may be necessary if the DN of the user itself contains special characters, backslash for example, that prevent correct user mapping. If the attribute does not exist, the entry’s DN is used.

fields.label: Parse username
fields.description: A flag indicating if the DN is to be parsed for the username. If set to true, the DN is parsed for the username. If set to false the DN is not parsed for the username. This option is used together with Username prefix and Username suffix.

fields.label: Username prefix
fields.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the start of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with Username suffix and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.

fields.label: Username suffix
fields.description: Defines the String which is to be removed from the end of the DN to reveal the username. This option is used together with Username prefix and only taken into account if parseUsername is set to true.

fields.label: Role attribute ID
fields.description: Name of the attribute containing the user roles

fields.label: Role context DN
fields.description: The fixed DN of the context to search for user roles. This is not the DN where the actual roles are, but the DN where the objects containing the user roles are. For example, in a Microsoft Active Directory server, this is the DN where the user account is.

fields.label: Role filter
fields.description: A search filter used to locate the roles associated with the authenticated user. The input username or userDN obtained from the login module callback is substituted into the filter anywhere a {0} expression is used. The authenticated userDN is substituted into the filter anywhere a {1} is used. An example search filter that matches on the input username is (member={0}). An alternative that matches on the authenticated userDN is (member={1}).

fields.label: Role recursion
fields.description: The number of levels of recursion the role search will go below a matching context. Disable recursion by setting this to 0.

fields.label: Default role
fields.description: A role included for all authenticated users

fields.label: Role name attribute ID
fields.description: Name of the attribute within the Role context DN that contains the role name. If the 'Role attribute is DN' property is set to true, this property is used to find the role object’s name attribute.

fields.label: Parse role name from DN
fields.description: A flag indicating if the DN returned by a query contains the 'Role name attribute ID'. If set to true, the DN is checked for the 'Role name attribute ID'. If set to false, the DN is not checked for the 'Role name attribute ID'. This flag can improve the performance of LDAP queries.

fields.label: Role attribute is DN
fields.description: Whether or not the 'Role attribute ID' contains the fully-qualified DN of a role object. If false, the role name is taken from the value of the 'Role name attribute ID' attribute of the context name. Certain directory schemas, such as Microsoft Active Directory, require this attribute to be set to true.

fields.label: Referral user attribute ID
fields.description: If you are not using referrals, you can ignore this option. When using referrals, this option denotes the attribute name which contains users defined for a certain role, for example member, if the role object is inside the referral. Users are checked against the content of this attribute name. If this option is not set, the check will always fail, so role objects cannot be stored in a referral tree

fields.label: Roles properties file
fields.description: When present, the RoleMapping Login Module will be configured to use the provided file. This property defines the fully-qualified file path and name of a properties file or resource which maps roles to replacement roles. The format is original_role=role1,role2,role3

fields.label: Replace roles
fields.description: Whether to add to the current roles, or replace the current roles with the mapped ones. Replaces if set to true.

fields.label: Kind
fields.description: Reference Kind for the RoleMapper.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Reference object name for the RoleMapper.

fields.label: AMQ password
fields.description: The password to use for AMQ user. Generated if empty

fields.label: AMQ cluster password
fields.description: Password for AMQ Cluster. Generated if empty

fields.label: Keystore password
fields.description: The password to use for keystore generation. Generated if empty

fields.label: Database password
fields.description: The password to use for databases. Generated if empty

fields.label: Image Context
fields.description: The image context to use for console e.g. rhpam-7, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image
fields.description: The image to use for console e.g. rhpam-businesscentral-rhel8, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image tag
fields.description: The image tag to use for console e.g. 7.9.0, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Keystore secret
fields.description: The secret name within the Java keystore used for https encryption. Generated if empty

fields.label: Replicas
fields.description: The number of replicas for the console component.

fields.label: StorageClass Name
fields.description: The storageClassName to use for console pvc's.

fields.label: Persistent Volume Size
fields.description: The size of the Business Central's Persistent Volume. Examples: 1Gi, 512Mi.

fields.label: Mount path
fields.description: Absolute path where the gitHooks folder will be mounted.

fields.label: Kind
fields.description: Reference Kind for the GitHooks.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Reference object Name for the GitHooks.

fields.label: SSH Secret
fields.description: Secret to use for ssh key and known hosts file. The secret must contain two files: id_rsa and known_hosts.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Environment variable name

fields.label: Value
fields.description: Environment variable value

fields.label: Memory request
fields.description: Minimum amount of memory requested by the container

fields.label: CPU request
fields.description: Minimum processing power requested by the container, default is 1000m

fields.label: Memory limit
fields.description: Maximum amount of memory granted to the container

fields.label: CPU limit
fields.description: Maximum processing power granted to the container, default is 2000m

fields.label: Enable JVM configuration
fields.description: When set to true will configure the RHPAM Workbench with JVM configuration, if no configuration is added, the defaults will be used.

fields.label: Java Opts append
fields.description: User specified Java options to be appended to generated options in JAVA_OPTS. e.g. '-Dsome.property=foo'.

fields.label: Java max memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xmx' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default maximal heap memory based on a containers restriction. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xmx' is set to a ratio of the container available memory as set here. The default is '50' which means 50% of the available memory is used as an upper boundary. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xmx' option is added.

fields.label: Java initial memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default initial heap memory based on the maximum heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is set to a ratio of the '-Xmx' memory as set here. The default is '25' which means 25% of the '-Xmx' is used as the initial heap size. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xms' option is added. e.g. '25'.

fields.label: Java max initial memory
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate the maximum value of the initial heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is limited to the value set here. The default is 4096Mb which means the calculated value of '-Xms' never will be greater than 4096Mb. The value of this variable is expressed in MB. e.g. '4096'.

fields.label: Java diagnostics
fields.description: Set this to get some diagnostics information to standard output when things are happening. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug
fields.description: If set remote debugging will be switched on. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug port
fields.description: Port used for remote debugging. Defaults to 5005. e.g. '8787'.

fields.label: GC min heap free ratio
fields.description: Minimum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid expansion. e.g. '20'.

fields.label: GC max heap free ratio
fields.description: Maximum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid shrinking. e.g. '40'.

fields.label: GC time ratio
fields.description: Specifies the ratio of the time spent outside the garbage collection (for example, the time spent for application execution) to the time spent in the garbage collection, it's desirable that not more than 1 / (1 + n) e.g. 99 means 1% spent on gc, 4 means spent 20% on gc.

fields.label: GC adaptive size policy weight
fields.description: The weighting given to the current GC time versus previous GC times when determining the new heap size, between 0 and 100. e.g. '90'

fields.label: GC max metaspace size
fields.description: The maximum metaspace size in Mega bytes unit e.g. 400

fields.label: GC gcContainerOptions
fields.description: Specify Java GC to use. The value of this variable should contain the necessary JRE command-line options to specify the required GC, which will override the default of '-XX:+UseParallelOldGC'. e.g. '-XX:+UseG1GC'.

fields.label: Client name
fields.description: Client name used for console in RH-SSO, when configured

fields.label: Client secret
fields.description: Client secret to use for console in RH-SSO, when configured

fields.label: SSO HTTP URL
fields.description: HTTP hostname to set as redirect URL, when RH-SSO is configured

fields.label: SSO HTTPS URL
fields.description: HTTPS hostname to set as redirect URL, when RH-SSO is configured

fields.label: Id
fields.description: The id to use for this KIE Server.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: The name to use for this KIE Server.

fields.label: Image Context
fields.description: The image context to use for server e.g. rhpam-7, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image
fields.description: The image to use for server e.g. rhpam-kieserver-rhel8, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image tag
fields.description: The image tag to use for server e.g. 7.9.0, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Deployments
fields.description: The number of distinct KIE Server sets to auto-generate, when specifying a single server element here.

fields.label: Keystore secret
fields.description: The secret name within the Java keystore used for https encryption. Generated if empty

fields.label: JBPM Cluster
fields.description: Enable the KIE Server Jbpm clustering for processes fail-over, it could increase the number of kieservers

fields.label: Replicas
fields.description: The number of replicas for this KIE Server set.

fields.label: Kind
fields.description: Specify whether containers are to be created from an image stream, or a container image.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: The name of the image stream or container image to use.

fields.label: Namespace
fields.description: Namespace where the image/stream is located.

fields.label: KIE Server container deployment
fields.description: KIE packages to deploy to the KIE Server.

fields.label: Disable KIE Jar Pull Dependencies
fields.description: Disable Maven pull dependencies for immutable KIE Server configurations for S2I and pre built kjars.

fields.label: Disable KIE Jar Verification
fields.description: Disable Maven KIE Jar verification. It is recommended to test the kjar manually before disabling this verification.

fields.label: Maven mirror URL
fields.description: URL of a Maven mirror to use.

fields.label: Artifact directory
fields.description: Build artifact directory.

fields.label: Kind
fields.description: Specify whether build config is created from an image stream, or a container image.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: The name of the image stream or container image to use for build config.

fields.label: Namespace
fields.description: Namespace where the build config image/stream is located.

fields.label: S2I Git URI
fields.description: The URI of the Git repository to use in S2I build.

fields.label: Reference
fields.description: Branch to use in the git repository for S2I build.

fields.label: Context directory
fields.description: Context/subdirectory where the code is located, relatively to repository root, to use for S2I build.

fields.label: Type
fields.description: Git WebHook type to configure, either GitHub or Generic.

fields.label: Secret
fields.description: Secret value for WebHook to configure. Generated if empty

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Environment variable name for build config

fields.label: Value
fields.description: Environment variable value for build config

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Environment variable name

fields.label: Value
fields.description: Environment variable value

fields.label: Memory request
fields.description: Minimum amount of memory requested by the container

fields.label: CPU request
fields.description: Minimum processing power requested by the container, default is 500m

fields.label: Memory limit
fields.description: Maximum amount of memory granted to the container

fields.label: CPU limit
fields.description: Maximum processing power granted to the container, default is 1000m

fields.label: Client name
fields.description: Client name used for this KIE Server in RH-SSO, when configured

fields.label: Client secret
fields.description: Client secret to use for this KIE Server in RH-SSO, when configured

fields.label: SSO HTTP URL
fields.description: HTTP hostname to set as redirect URL, when RH-SSO is configured

fields.label: SSO HTTPS URL
fields.description: HTTPS hostname to set as redirect URL, when RH-SSO is configured

fields.label: Enable JMS integration
fields.description: When set to true will configure the KIE Server with JMS integration, if no configuration is added, the default will be used.

fields.label: Executor
fields.description: Set false to disable the JMS executor, it is enabled by default.

fields.label: Queue executor
fields.description: JNDI name of executor queue for JMS, example queue/CUSTOM.KIE.SERVER.EXECUTOR, default is queue/KIE.SERVER.EXECUTOR.

fields.label: Executor transacted
fields.description: Enable transactions for JMS executor, disabled by default.

fields.label: Queue request
fields.description: JNDI name of request queue for JMS, example queue/CUSTOM.KIE.SERVER.REQUEST, default is queue/KIE.SERVER.REQUEST.

fields.label: Queue response
fields.description: JNDI name of executor queue for JMS, example queue/CUSTOM.KIE.SERVER.RESPONSE, default is queue/KIE.SERVER.RESPONSEx`x`.

fields.label: Enable signal
fields.description: Enable the Signal configuration through JMS. Default is false.

fields.label: Queue signal
fields.description: JNDI name of signal queue for JMS, example queue/CUSTOM.KIE.SERVER.SIGNAL, default is queue/KIE.SERVER.SIGNAL.

fields.label: Enable audit
fields.description: Enable the Audit logging through JMS. Default is false.

fields.label: Queue audit
fields.description: JNDI name of audit logging queue for JMS, example queue/CUSTOM.KIE.SERVER.AUDIT, default is queue/KIE.SERVER.AUDIT.

fields.label: Audit transacted
fields.description: Enable transactions for JMS executor, disabled by default.

fields.label: User name
fields.description: AMQ broker username to connect do the AMQ, generated if empty.

fields.label: Password
fields.description: AMQ broker password to connect do the AMQ, generated if empty.

fields.label: AMQ queues
fields.description: AMQ broker broker comma separated queues, if empty the values from default queues will be used.

fields.label: Enable SSL integration
fields.description: When set to true will configure the KIE Server with JMS integration, if no configuration is added, the default will be used.

fields.label: AMQ secret name
fields.description: The name of a secret containing AMQ SSL related files.

fields.label: AMQ truststore name
fields.description: The name of the AMQ SSL Trust Store file.

fields.label: AMQ truststore password
fields.description: The password for the AMQ Trust Store.

fields.label: AMQ Keystore Name
fields.description: The name of the AMQ SSL Trust Store file.

fields.label: AMQ keystore password
fields.description: The password for the AMQ keystore and certificate.

fields.label: Enable JVM configuration
fields.description: When set to true will configure the KIE Server with JVM configuration, if no configuration is added, the defaults will be used.

fields.label: Java Opts append
fields.description: User specified Java options to be appended to generated options in JAVA_OPTS. e.g. '-Dsome.property=foo'.

fields.label: Java max memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xmx' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default maximal heap memory based on a containers restriction. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xmx' is set to a ratio of the container available memory as set here. The default is '50' which means 50% of the available memory is used as an upper boundary. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xmx' option is added.

fields.label: Java initial memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default initial heap memory based on the maximum heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is set to a ratio of the '-Xmx' memory as set here. The default is '25' which means 25% of the '-Xmx' is used as the initial heap size. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xms' option is added. e.g. '25'.

fields.label: Java max initial memory
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate the maximum value of the initial heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is limited to the value set here. The default is 4096Mb which means the calculated value of '-Xms' never will be greater than 4096Mb. The value of this variable is expressed in MB. e.g. '4096'.

fields.label: Java diagnostics
fields.description: Set this to get some diagnostics information to standard output when things are happening. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug
fields.description: If set remote debugging will be switched on. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug port
fields.description: Port used for remote debugging. Defaults to 5005. e.g. '8787'.

fields.label: GC min heap free ratio
fields.description: Minimum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid expansion. e.g. '20'.

fields.label: GC max heap free ratio
fields.description: Maximum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid shrinking. e.g. '40'.

fields.label: GC time ratio
fields.description: Specifies the ratio of the time spent outside the garbage collection (for example, the time spent for application execution) to the time spent in the garbage collection, it's desirable that not more than 1 / (1 + n) e.g. 99 means 1% spent on gc, 4 means spent 20% on gc.

fields.label: GC adaptive size policy weight
fields.description: The weighting given to the current GC time versus previous GC times when determining the new heap size, between 0 and 100. e.g. '90'.

fields.label: GC max metaspace size
fields.description: The maximum metaspace size in Mega bytes unit e.g. 400

fields.label: GC gcContainerOptions
fields.description: Specify Java GC to use. The value of this variable should contain the necessary JRE command-line options to specify the required GC, which will override the default of '-XX:+UseParallelOldGC'. e.g. '-XX:+UseG1GC'.

fields.label: Size
fields.description: Size of the Persistent Volume Claim to create. For example, 100Gi

fields.label: StorageClass Name
fields.description: The storageClassName to use for database pvc's.

fields.label: Enable Extension image stream
fields.description: When set to true will configure the KIE Server with Extension Image Stream.

fields.label: Extension image stream tag
fields.description: ImageStreamTag definition for the image containing the drivers and configuration. For example, custom-driver-image:7.7.0.

fields.label: Extension image stream namespace
fields.description: Namespace within which the ImageStream definition for the image containing the drivers and configuration is located. Defaults to openshift namespace.

fields.label: Extension image install directory
fields.description: Full path to the directory within the extensions image where the extensions are located (e.g. install.sh, modules/, etc.).

fields.label: Driver
fields.description: Database driver.

fields.label: Dialect
fields.description: Database Hibernate Dialect.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Database name.

fields.label: Host
fields.description: Database hostname.

fields.label: Port
fields.description: Database port.

fields.label: Jdbc URL
fields.description: Database JDBC URL.

fields.label: NonXA
fields.description: Select this option to configure database in non XA mode.

fields.label: User name
fields.description: KIE Server external database username.

fields.label: Password
fields.description: KIE Server external database password.

fields.label: Mininimum connection pool size
fields.description: Sets xa-pool/min-pool-size for the configured datasource.

fields.label: Maximum connection pool size
fields.description: Sets xa-pool/max-pool-size for the configured datasource.

fields.label: Valid connection checker class
fields.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ValidConnectionChecker that provides a SQLException isValidConnection(Connection e) method to validate if a connection is valid.

fields.label: Exception sorter class
fields.description: An org.jboss.jca.adapters.jdbc.ExceptionSorter that provides a boolean isExceptionFatal(SQLException e) method to validate if an exception should be broadcast to all javax.resource.spi.ConnectionEventListener as a connectionErrorOccurred.

fields.label: Background validation
fields.description: Sets the sql validation method to background-validation, if set to false the validate-on-match method will be used.

fields.label: Background validation interval (milliseconds)
fields.description: Defines the interval for the background-validation check for the jdbc connections.

fields.label: Enable integration with Business Central
fields.description: Enables integration with Business Central.

fields.label: Enable integration with KIE Server
fields.description: Enables integration with KIE Server

fields.label: Allow External File Register
fields.description: Allow download of external (remote) files into runtime.

fields.label: Partition Component by ID
fields.description: Components will be partitioned by the Runtime Model ID.

fields.label: Partition Datasets by ID
fields.description: Datasets IDs will partitioned by the Runtime Model ID.

fields.label: ImportFileLocation
fields.description: Set a static dashboard to run with runtime. When this property is set no new imports are allowed.

fields.label: Persistent Dashbuilder Configurations
fields.description: Make Dashbuilder not ephemeral. All needed Persistent Volumes will be created.

fields.label: Imports Base Directory
fields.description: Base Directory where dashboards ZIPs are stored. If PersistentConfigs is enabled and ExternalCompDir is not pointing to a already existing PV the /opt/kie/data/components directory will be used.

fields.label: Model Update
fields.description: Allows Runtime to check model last update in FS to update its content.

fields.label: Model File Removal
fields.description: When enabled will also remove actual model file from file system.

fields.label: Runtime Multiple Import
fields.description: Runtime will always allow use of new imports (multi tenancy).

fields.label: Upload File Size
fields.description: Limits the size of uploaded dashboards (in kb). Default value is 10485760 kb.

fields.label: Enable Components
fields.description: When set to true enables external components.

fields.label: External Components Directory
fields.description: Base Directory where dashboards ZIPs are stored. If PersistentConfigs is enabled and ExternalCompDir is not ointing to a already existing PV the /opt/kie/data/components directory will be used.

fields.label: Config Map Properties
fields.description: Properties file with Dashbuilder configurations, if set, uniq properties will be appended and, if a property is set mode than once, the one from this property file will be used.

fields.label: Username
fields.description: Not needed if token is set.

fields.label: Password
fields.description: Not needed if token is set.

fields.label: Username
fields.description: Not needed if token is set.

fields.label: Password
fields.description: Not needed if token is set.

fields.label: Image Context
fields.description: The image context to use for Dashbuilder e.g. rhpam-7, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image
fields.description: The image to use for Dashbuilder e.g. rhpam-dashbuilder-rhel8, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image tag
fields.description: The image tag to use for Dashbuilder e.g. 7.10.0, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Keystore secret
fields.description: The secret name within the Java keystore used for https encryption. Generated if empty

fields.label: Replicas
fields.description: The number of replicas for the Dashbuilder component.

fields.label: StorageClass Name
fields.description: The storageClassName to use for Dashbuilder pvc's.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Environment variable name

fields.label: Value
fields.description: Environment variable value

fields.label: Memory request
fields.description: Minimum amount of memory requested by the container

fields.label: CPU request
fields.description: Minimum processing power requested by the container, default is 750m

fields.label: Memory limit
fields.description: Maximum amount of memory granted to the container

fields.label: CPU limit
fields.description: Maximum processing power granted to the container, default is 1000m

fields.label: Enable JVM configuration
fields.description: When set to true will configure the RHPAM Dashbuilder with JVM configuration, if no configuration is added, the defaults will be used.

fields.label: Java Opts append
fields.description: User specified Java options to be appended to generated options in JAVA_OPTS. e.g. '-Dsome.property=foo'.

fields.label: Java max memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xmx' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default maximal heap memory based on a containers restriction. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xmx' is set to a ratio of the container available memory as set here. The default is '50' which means 50% of the available memory is used as an upper boundary. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xmx' option is added.

fields.label: Java initial memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default initial heap memory based on the maximum heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is set to a ratio of the '-Xmx' memory as set here. The default is '25' which means 25% of the '-Xmx' is used as the initial heap size. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xms' option is added. e.g. '25'.

fields.label: Java max initial memory
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate the maximum value of the initial heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is limited to the value set here. The default is 4096Mb which means the calculated value of '-Xms' never will be greater than 4096Mb. The value of this variable is expressed in MB. e.g. '4096'.

fields.label: Java diagnostics
fields.description: Set this to get some diagnostics information to standard output when things are happening. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug
fields.description: If set remote debugging will be switched on. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug port
fields.description: Port used for remote debugging. Defaults to 5005. e.g. '8787'.

fields.label: GC min heap free ratio
fields.description: Minimum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid expansion. e.g. '20'.

fields.label: GC max heap free ratio
fields.description: Maximum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid shrinking. e.g. '40'.

fields.label: GC time ratio
fields.description: Specifies the ratio of the time spent outside the garbage collection (for example, the time spent for application execution) to the time spent in the garbage collection, it's desirable that not more than 1 / (1 + n) e.g. 99 means 1% spent on gc, 4 means spent 20% on gc.

fields.label: GC adaptive size policy weight
fields.description: The weighting given to the current GC time versus previous GC times when determining the new heap size, between 0 and 100. e.g. '90'

fields.label: GC max metaspace size
fields.description: The maximum metaspace size in Mega bytes unit e.g. 400

fields.label: GC gcContainerOptions
fields.description: Specify Java GC to use. The value of this variable should contain the necessary JRE command-line options to specify the required GC, which will override the default of '-XX:+UseParallelOldGC'. e.g. '-XX:+UseG1GC'.

fields.label: Client name
fields.description: Client name used for dashbuilder in RH-SSO, when configured

fields.label: Client secret
fields.description: Client secret to use for dashbuilder in RH-SSO, when configured

fields.label: SSO HTTP URL
fields.description: HTTP hostname to set as redirect URL, when RH-SSO is configured

fields.label: SSO HTTPS URL
fields.description: HTTPS hostname to set as redirect URL, when RH-SSO is configured

fields.label: Keystore secret
fields.description: The secret name within the Java keystore used for https encryption. Generated if empty.

fields.label: Image Context
fields.description: The image context to use for smart router e.g. rhpam-7, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image
fields.description: The image to use for smart router e.g. rhpam-smartrouter-rhel8, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image tag
fields.description: The image tag to use for smart router e.g. 7.9.0, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Replicas
fields.description: The number of replicas for the console component.

fields.label: StorageClass Name
fields.description: The storageClassName to use for smart router pvc's.

fields.label: Name
fields.description: Environment variable name

fields.label: Value
fields.description: Environment variable value

fields.label: Memory request
fields.description: Minimum amount of memory requested by the container

fields.label: CPU request
fields.description: Minimum processing power requested by the container, default is 250m

fields.label: Memory limit
fields.description: Maximum amount of memory granted to the container

fields.label: CPU limit
fields.description: Maximum processing power granted to the container, default is 500m

fields.label: Enable JVM configuration
fields.description: When set to true will configure the Smart Router with JVM configuration, if no configuration is added, the defaults will be used.

fields.label: Java Opts append
fields.description: User specified Java options to be appended to generated options in JAVA_OPTS. e.g. '-Dsome.property=foo'.

fields.label: Java max memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xmx' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default maximal heap memory based on a containers restriction. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xmx' is set to a ratio of the container available memory as set here. The default is '50' which means 50% of the available memory is used as an upper boundary. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xmx' option is added.

fields.label: Java initial memory ratio
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate a default initial heap memory based on the maximum heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is set to a ratio of the '-Xmx' memory as set here. The default is '25' which means 25% of the '-Xmx' is used as the initial heap size. You can skip this mechanism by setting this value to '0' in which case no '-Xms' option is added. e.g. '25'.

fields.label: Java max initial memory
fields.description: Is used when no '-Xms' option is given in JAVA_OPTS. This is used to calculate the maximum value of the initial heap memory. If used in a container without any memory constraints for the container then this option has no effect. If there is a memory constraint then '-Xms' is limited to the value set here. The default is 4096Mb which means the calculated value of '-Xms' never will be greater than 4096Mb. The value of this variable is expressed in MB. e.g. '4096'.

fields.label: Java diagnostics
fields.description: Set this to get some diagnostics information to standard output when things are happening. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug
fields.description: If set remote debugging will be switched on. Disabled by default. e.g. 'true'.

fields.label: Java debug port
fields.description: Port used for remote debugging. Defaults to 5005. e.g. '8787'.

fields.label: GC min heap free ratio
fields.description: Minimum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid expansion. e.g. '20'.

fields.label: GC max heap free ratio
fields.description: Maximum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid shrinking. e.g. '40'.

fields.label: GC time ratio
fields.description: Specifies the ratio of the time spent outside the garbage collection (for example, the time spent for application execution) to the time spent in the garbage collection, it's desirable that not more than 1 / (1 + n) e.g. 99 means 1% spent on gc, 4 means spent 20% on gc.

fields.label: GC adaptive size policy weight
fields.description: The weighting given to the current GC time versus previous GC times when determining the new heap size, between 0 and 100. e.g. '90'

fields.label: GC max metaspace size
fields.description: The maximum metaspace size in Mega bytes unit e.g. 400

fields.label: GC gcContainerOptions
fields.description: Specify Java GC to use. The value of this variable should contain the necessary JRE command-line options to specify the required GC, which will override the default of '-XX:+UseParallelOldGC'. e.g. '-XX:+UseG1GC'.

fields.label: Image Context
fields.description: The image context to use for Process Instance Migration e.g. rhpam-7, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image
fields.description: The image to use for Process Instance Migration e.g. rhpam-process-migration-rhel8, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Image tag
fields.description: The image tag to use for Process Instance Migration e.g. 7.9.0, this param is optional for custom image.

fields.label: Size
fields.description: Size of the Persistent Volume Claim to create. For example, 100Gi

fields.label: storageClassName
fields.description: The storageClassName to use for database pvc's.
